reviews.text: One of the most beautiful palaces I have ever seen. This is not a mere exaggeration but it's the fact. The palace, the surrounding areas covered by the garden, all are very neat and clean. The museum indexed the palace gives you the glimpse of the history of the rulers of the city and their successors. Just beside it is a ground where horse races are conducted. Outside the palace entry gate is a zoo, where one can catch the glimpse of different kinds of birds in the lake beside it.

This is very interesting historic place. Very beautiful palace and a fantastic  museum. We can see  ancient  oil paintings, Rulers old photos, coins, old clothes which is used by King. There are different kinds of arms and ammunition like old guns, spears,knives,swords etc.

Another beautiful  attraction in the museum is  stuffed wild animals and birds.

* I have posted few pictures of this place. Hit 'LIKE' if they are helpful to you.

Beautiful palace with a nice collection in the museum inside the palace. An adult ticket cost Rs 35 to see the museum. Photography is strictly prohibited, you are instructed to keep your phone switched off inside the palace. The lawn is lush green, people can sit and relax and can take as many pics as they want. Ideal time to invest is 1-2 hours.

Beautiful Palace!
Nice museum of historical items, furniture,photographs, wildlife & arms etc.
Palace n surrounding area is beautiful..neat n clean! Ample space for parking.
Small garden in front of palace is well maintained.
# only inconvenience is ticket window for the museum is on main gate of palace; that should be nearby palace.

Historical place. Entrance fee is must.  Parking space. Photos are not allowed. Not crowded. Usually it takes an hour. Beautiful background to take pictures. 
Palace is maintained and lawn as well. Huge trees around. Animals are present too. Specially interesting for kids and historical lovers

(Even though it is very old it is meaningful in Kolhapur history. A must sightseeing point)
Wonderful place and new experience

Small but nice. Its quite nice considering the size of Bergamo. The ticket costs 3€, which includes admission to the natural science museum. All written signs are in italian but i think there are audio guides.
It is very old and the exposition has seen a better days, but as the entrance is free why not to come in...
Tiny, tiny museum. But together with museum of natural history (which is much bigger, and share the same 3 euro ticket) is ok.
Piccolo Museo incentrato sulla storia locale con diversi reperti delle varie epoche ritrovati nel territorio bergamasco, soprattutto romani.
Off-putting from the street, then charming inside, this is a nice half hour break from the city. Kids would like it.
nice place but the guides doesnt speak english
Great!
Excelente lugar para enseñar a niños sobre historia natural
Um dos museus mais baratos e imperdíveis de Cochabamba! Bem organizado e com muita história!

This place is great! Most of the exhibits have explanation in English as well as Slovak.
The woolly mammoth is the top!
Never thought I would see such a thing...I also need to mention a bison and a giraffe...
Proper cool...
Been there only once at the Tibet Himalaya exhibition and I liked it. A pleasant surprise.

The museum exhibits a vast range of specimens from various segments of natural history, mainly focused on presentation of the diversity of living and non-living nature in Slovakia. The museum also hosts a variety of temporary exhibitions (check the program on official website).

The museum had interesting exhibits but they could have been better organized and presented. Many tags were written only in Slovak and that made it difficult to follow the exhibitions. You should totally visit if you have a lot of time but i would prefer something else if on a tight schedule

Really interesting museum for all nature lovers. Some taxidermy pieces were really done well, and I love the backgrounds which were made like their real habitat. Whole exhibition is a chronological story from the begining of the life on planet Earth to life we know today. I have so much photos which I could share, but it is best for you to go there and experience it yourself. :)
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.
